poem:
**Flight Patterns**  

In the parlance of black and white,   
a magpie charts its draft—  
not always cawing for the smoothest route,  
some actors learn the trick of the light  
and bend their voices skyward;  
others find their wings in the shadows,  
knuckles wrapped tight,  
waiting for a stage to turn  
wind into flight.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Magpie review – Daisy Riadley shines in tense, compelling portrait of a toxic relationship The post Star Wars trajectory is a mixed bag for actors. Maybe you get lucky, go the Harrison Ford route and become one of the shiniest movie stars of your generation. Maybe you’re more of a Mark Hamill type – initially out in the cold, before carving out a niche (in Hamill’s case as a sought after voice actor) and going". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
